dublin_core.dcvalue: The Whole Systems Demonstrator was a large pragmatic cluster randomised trial that compared telehealth with usual care among 3 230 patients with long term conditions in three areas of England Telehealth involved the regular transmission of physiological information such as blood glucose to health professionals working remotely We examined whether telehealth led to changes in glycosylated haemoglobin HbA1c among the subset of patients with type 2 diabetes
Effect of telehealth on glycaemic control: analysis of patients with type 2 diabetes in the Whole Systems Demonstrator cluster randomised trial.
